storyInfo: With Anastasio in hot pursuit, Juana has no choice but to steer the ship into the valley of gushing steam. The final showdown looms near.

attributes.content: Isidro!
...Ugh... argh...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: —*cough* *cough*!!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: All hands on deck! I'll take the helm! Pascuala and Weedy, take care of Teach!
attributes.name: Juana
Juana
attributes.content: The Inquisition's ship is catching up. Wake up, Isidro! Stand up—

attributes.name: Juana
attributes.content: What happened to your arm?
—Tsk. They're catching up again. Elysium! Isidro! Can you still swing a sword?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Mine broke! But I can pummel them with my flag!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: ...But who would use a flag as a weapon on the battlefield?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Isidro grabs his right arm. The searing pain has not yet subsided.
My left hand is all I need.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Good—
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Look out! They're loading!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: The wind carries the cries from the salt ship behind them.
'—Fire!'
We're still not fast enough.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Can we make it into the Skeletal Reef before they catch up?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Even if we can't, I have no intention of stopping.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: But the ship's badly damaged... I only managed to repair part of it. That hit we just took went through half the hold!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: And took all Isidro's alchemy equipment out with it! Without the compass, how are we supposed to get out of Skeletal Reef, even if we make it in?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Isidro can feel the Corazonix pulsating beneath his glove.
He may have lost an arm, but all is not lost.
...There will be a way.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro casts his eyes towards the Skeletal Reef. The bones littering the ground grow larger with every passing moment.
One kilometer.
Turning is no longer an option for La Conquista. Juana grabs the helm wheel with such strength that the wood creaks under the pressure.
She leans forward, eyes fixed dead ahead on the terrifying Skeletal Reef, as though it is her prey.
Five hundred meters.
A sharp grain of salt brushes past her cheek, leaving a mark.
Pascuala squints into the wind and salt, but can only barely see the massive sails approaching from behind.
One hundred meters.
Microorganisms have dyed the bleached bones crimson.
This land had never seen such vivid colors, even before the sea came.
Fifty meters.
Steam gushes through the holes in the bones, powerful and dense.
At their end is a crimson mist the color of blood, spraying into the wind.
Ten meters.
All breaths are held.
La Conquista roars into the valley. Dozens of steam pillars blast out from the skeletons lining the sides of the canyon, filling the space that it occupied mere moments ago.
They tear through sails like paper.
The salt ship following in hot pursuit, a monstrosity dozens of meters in length, is torn to pieces as though a toy.
The mast, dragged down by tattered sails, lies across the gorge, before the steam breaks it too in half, sending the pieces plunging into the salt.
Scraps of wood and bone fly into the air, forming a sharp, deadly rain.
Their ship was destroyed by the steam!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Holy finshit! I'm alive! I'm actually alive!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: It's too early to celebrate.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Salt dust is blown away by the steam, revealing yet another salt ship, trampling the carcass of its brethren beneath its heel as it charges towards them.
The flag of the Inquisition flies high upon its mast, yet it is Anastasio, standing beneath it, whose presence commands more attention.
They've got guts, I'll give them that.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Let this be their burial ground, then.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Hooks!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Dozens of hooks fly towards La Conquista. Most fall harmlessly into the salt, but a few find the gaps upon her hull.
La Conquista is heavier than us! Don't try to pull it in, let it drag us towards it!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Board once we're close enough, and take that ship!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Taut ropes creak as both ships tremble. The sailors draw their weapons, sizing up the distance between the ships.
Suddenly, a spinning helm wheel flies out from the stern of La Conquista, snapping the ropes linking the two ships.
The sharper-eyed sailors recognize it immediately.
It's Juana!
attributes.name: Frightened Sailor

attributes.content: At that terrified cry, a figure in black leaps from La Conquista and lands on the salt ship.
Have you already forgotten everything I taught you?!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You couldn't hook a bloody saltfin, the way you're tossing those!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: She wants to take our helm wheel! Stop her!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You fight like a starving saltfin! No, worse!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Hold that cutlass properly! What are you trying to do, cut a steak?!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Don't kill Juana! All we need is the compass!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Open your damn eyes, Javier!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: She's here to kill us! It's us or her! We gotta kill her for the reward!
attributes.name: Frightened Sailor

attributes.content: I was right all along, Javier! You're just her little pet!
attributes.name: Howling Sailor

attributes.content: Well, I'm not! I want to live! I want to live good! If you don't want that bounty, I'll take it!
attributes.name: Howling Sailor

attributes.content: Juana swings her helm wheel into a charging pirate, who falls to the ground in a heap, but the rest keep coming with even greater fury.
Javier is left in the back. He grips his weapon tight, but does not move his feet.
It takes a while before he cries out—
I said! Don't kill Juana! All we need is the compass!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: But I'm going to kill YOU, Javier.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Quit giving orders, Javier! Who do you think you are?
attributes.name: Howling Sailor

attributes.content: Kill Juana! Her head will make us rich!
attributes.name: Howling Sailor

attributes.content: Just as no one can shake their own shadow, Isidro turns around to see Anastasio standing behind him.
There you are.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Form up, my brothers! Attack!
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Sir!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Elysium! Protect the helm with Weedy! Don't let them take control!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Leaf, switch to attack mode!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: How dare you kick away the waterproof boots I gave Thorns! Did you think a communications specialist couldn't fight?
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Stay away from me with that stinking mop of yours!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: It's a FLAG, you scuttlehead! I wash it every week! Or at least try to!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: You have very nearly killed me twice now, Isidro. A feat none before have accomplished.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Why then do you so earnestly seek my death? What is this desire you have failed to realize because of me? This desire that is so much stronger than anyone else's?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I don't have any desires.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: ...Impossible. All mortals are driven by desire.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Myself first and foremost.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: If you're driven by desire too, then you have no right to kill people in the name of suppressing it... Even if you're with the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: The Inquisition? No. Once, I wished for nothing more than that priest from the Inquisition to kill me and end my sinful life.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: But alas, he denied his own right to judge me, to execute me... and in so doing denied my right to die.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You still have that right, Isidro. The right to an easy end.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I have no interest in dying.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Maybe so, but you have been tainted by the strongest of all desires, no? Then you have already lost your free will.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You are compelled to sin. You simply cannot stop yourself.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Why do you hide your broken right arm with that glove?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Those controlled by desire always refuse to admit that their obsession will lead them to ruin.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: You cannot turn back. No one like you can. So I will kill you to stop your sins.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: But before that, you shall first face your desire! Acknowledge it!
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Only by doing so can you die sober and fighting.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Anastasio's sword slices through the air with a piercing shrill, targeting Isidro's right hand. Isidro twists his body at a nearly impossible angle to evade, but the blade's tip still rips through his glove.
Corazonix seeps out of the tear in his glove, turning into delicate ribbons that drift towards every corner of the valley.
...What's going on?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: So that is where you have hidden the compass.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: I have watched over that anathema for so many years, yet not once have seen it respond so eagerly to one's desires.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Such powerful desire, Isidro, yet you do not even know it.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: If you knew the first thing about alchemy, you'd know it doesn't respond to desire. Not mine or anyone else's.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Under the manipulation of an alchemist, Corazonix leaves the compass and enters the natural cycle before returning to the compass. Then the alchemist deciphers the information it brings back.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: That is its basic principle. It has nothing to do with anything as subjective as desire.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro has read too many alchemical tomes and listened to too many of Aulus's lessons. He could recite these principles backward and forward.
But he cannot help but ask himself: Is that really everything there is to the compass, to Corazonix?
Why did the Corazonix on his arm start drifting without any input from him?
Does he not want to know what it is responding to?
Does he not want to know what he wants?
The distraction is enough for Anastasio's sword to pierce his left shoulder.
—Argh!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Where is your desire, Isidro? That most powerful desire that compels you to kill me?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Will you die as the puppet of that desire, without even knowing what it is?!
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Found her! She's got someone on her back! Get her!
attributes.name: Tall Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Go!
attributes.name: Pursuing Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Can't... run... so... heavy...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Put me down... Go on without me...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: —Grr!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Pascuala?
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Pascuala!
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: You can't run like this! They'll get us both! Drop me and run!
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: I'm not letting go!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You gave me your blanket, your water, and you put me to bed...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: I... I'm not letting go!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: We just hit something! The ship's drifting! I can't keep it on course!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Out of the way! Let me handle it!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: How—
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Trust in the Liquid Nitrogen Cannon! But I may not get the output exactly right, so keep your hand on the wheel!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: You got it!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Bone swords rattle. Saltfin hide armor clashes. A roaring sailor walks up to Juana.
The other sailors pull their armor off and form a circle of flesh and blood. Inside the circle is Juana, and the sailor who issued the challenge.
Juana is taken aback for an instant, then laughs as she understands.
So you remember the tradition.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: How could we forget? You taught us how to challenge the leader when we were kids!
attributes.name: Fearless Sailor

attributes.content: But now your life is worth big money, enough to set me up for life!
attributes.name: Fearless Sailor

attributes.content: —Come at me then!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Juana swings the helm wheel with a whoosh and slams it into the man's bare chest with a sickeningly dull thud.
His chest collapses, and he falls onto the deck without so much as a gurgle and wheeze.
But the others step over his blood, crying in fury as they rush towards Juana with weapons in hand.
Die!
attributes.name: Howling Sailor

attributes.content: Hah!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Raaaah!
attributes.name: Roaring Sailor

attributes.content: Yet another sailor charges forward, but hesitates for an instant when his eyes meet Juana's.

His axe slows for a split second, just enough time for Juana's helm wheel to connect first. The last thing he sees is the pale salts filling his eyes, even as the lower half of his body clings to the deck.
This is no place to be getting cold feet!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: A moment of hesitation is the difference between life and death!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Who's next?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Another sailor steps up through the pool of blood, cutlass in hand. She seems a little thinner and frailer than the others.
Oh... if it isn't little Lomi?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Aye, boss. It's me.
attributes.name: Frail Sailor

attributes.content: What do you plan to do with the reward money?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I got a daughter. It's all hers!
attributes.name: Frail Sailor

attributes.content: Good! Then come and claim what is hers!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The frail sailor gulps and swings her cutlass at Juana, who lands a blow first with a backhand swing.
One of her arms hits the ground, unleashing a spray of blood.
Her other arm, however, continues clenching her cutlass.
Come! Raise your weapon! We're not done yet!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Haah... Ahhh...
attributes.name: Frail Sailor

attributes.content: Arrrggghhh!!!
attributes.name: Frail Sailor

attributes.content: Once again, she musters the courage to charge at Juana, but the heavy helm wheel finds her forehead faster.
Suddenly, the frail sailor is pushed aside.
Stop.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I'll do it.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...Thought you didn't want us to kill her?
attributes.name: Frail Sailor

attributes.content: No. I'm your leader. At this point, what you want is what I want.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And as your leader, I'm supposed to protect you, not watch you walk to your deaths one by one.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Javier draws his weapon and wades into the blood.
Your move, Juana.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: *pant* *pant* Urghh—!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You can put me down here. I'm feeling better. I can fight.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: *pant* *pant* These chupamedias... they're like saltfins who smell blood... can't shake them...
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: You've finally stopped. How many times have you taken what doesn't belong to you, you dirty little thief? You've got nerve to still be talking here.
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Catch the thief and the bandit! Bring them back to the Inquisition!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: ...'Thief'?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: 'What doesn't belong to me'?
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Pascuala picks up a fallen cutlass and charges at the warrior priests before her, red with fury.
Bloodsucking finshit! I could've lived a decent life until you people came after me and threw me out! How dare you assume I've become immoral just because my family has fallen on hard times?!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: What's she going on about... She's gone mad! Kill her!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: All I wanted that day was to go back home and get what was mine as a kid! I wasn't stealing! My abuela made that bracelet for me!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: What's wrong with taking what is mine? Who do you think you are, branding me a thief, no matter what I did, no matter what I said! I even begged you—
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Begged you to let me find a job in town and live a decent life! But you people called me a thief and kicked me out!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Well, now I'm a thief! Are you happy now? Are you happy?!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Inquisition finshit! You don't get to tell me what belongs to me or not!
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Aaaaaaaahhhhhhhh––!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: We're flying!!!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Objectively speaking, the ship did, in fact, go airborne for a few seconds. I may have overtuned the LN cannon a tad... But don't worry, I also have a smaller water cannon to help slow it down...
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: We're going too fast! I can't avoid that bone up ahead! Do something with that cannon of yours!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: I don't know if I can knock away a bone as big as that! Brace for impact!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: It's not fair... I just fixed the ship!
attributes.name: Weedy

attributes.content: There's someone here!
attributes.name: Warrior Priest

attributes.content: Didn't we just get rid of you?!
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Alright, I'll deal with them. Weedy, you fix up the ship. Again.
attributes.name: Elysium

attributes.content: Javier's blade meets the helm wheel with a dull clang that echoes through the valley. He feels his arms going numb.
Hesitantly, he strings a few words together in the gaps between attacks.
Juana... what do you... think you're doing...?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Killing traitors.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: No... Juana!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: If all you wanted was to kill us, you could've done so easily. Why hold to the tradition?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You're trying to tell us to affirm our decision by facing you with courage?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Am I wrong? AM I WRONG?!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: *pant* *pant* Juana...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Javier...
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: If you've realized that, why are you still holding back?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Isidro's left arm is shaking with pain. His sword has already left his hand.
Under Anastasio's incessant interrogation, he finds himself overcome by an even sharper pain.
The dispersed Corazonix once again converges upon him, having drifted amidst the salt and steam.
You asked what I want.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I want Juana to sail upon the seas that she's longed for all these years.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I want Pascuala to go to bed with a full stomach, not wake up in the middle of the night from hunger.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I want Weedy to go back safely to her research, and for Elysium to make it on time to that concert he's been looking forward to.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Yet all I see is how you people tear each other apart as you hasten to your own demise.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Who, precisely, did this tragedy begin with?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Juana. She, who has forgotten the pain of the Profound Silence. She, who is determined to ride to her doom seeking thrills that live on only in her memory.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: It was her desire that dragged Pascuala into the abyss. The girl who wanted nothing more than food on the table was made to steal the Inquisition's forbidden relic, blinded by greed and promises of riches.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: And then the rest of your fellows. When you say you wish their lives to return to normalcy, have you given any thought as to why they fell to abnormality?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: It was because of you, Isidro.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Juana's desire infected you, and you in turn have infected more innocents.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: ...I know.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: People are affected by one another. There's nothing wrong with that.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Everyone I met at Aarón kept their head down and their windows shut. No one spoke a word to each other, unless it was absolutely necessary.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Maybe it's the teachings of the Inquisition, or maybe the trauma of the great calamity that's never faded from their hearts. I couldn't say.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: What I can say, though, is that no one should have to live like that.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Anastasio pulls his sword out of Isidro's shoulder.
Carrying the red glow of the steam, the Corazonix returns to its place inside Isidro's glove and once again flows upon his arm.
For an instant, he can feel the gushing heat of the entire Skeletal Reef converged upon his right arm.
Go on, Isidro. If you have finally decided to expose your true nature, then I shall hear your confession.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Because of my mentor, for a very long time, I thought the ultimate end of human interaction was consumption and assimilation, just like the Seaborn.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I thought I would be consumed by others just as I consumed them. That there would always be people compelled by someone else's desires, held hostage by someone else's decisions, ultimately losing sight of their own selves.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: In the years before I joined Rhodes Island, I did my utmost to avoid something like that happening... like what happened to the people of Aarón.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: But now, I understand that the 'self' I had tried so hard to protect was empty. There was nothing there.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Even after I earned some money, I lived exactly as I had as a vagabond. I wore the same clothes, ate the same food, stayed in the same places, did the same things.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I didn't know what I wanted. Maybe I didn't want anything.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Is it not happiness to live as an empty canvas?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Is that not true freedom?
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Unlike your current self, the one forced to drag but more innocent souls into the abyss, as you have done.
attributes.name: Anastasio

attributes.content: Juana gave me a chance to leave. I chose to stay. Neither of us regrets our decisions.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: So, if I indeed dragged Elysium and Weedy into this, then I should give them a chance to leave or stay.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: If you want to kill them, then I'll just have to kill you first.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro senses the once chaotic movement of the Corazonix becoming rhythmic. With each pulse on his arm, steam bursts from the nearby bones.
It dawns on him that the Corazonix, salvaged from the transmutation table, is now fulfilling its intended function while attached to him.
He wants to lead his friends out of this deadly Skeletal Reef, so it is guiding him by indicating the direction of the searing steam flowing through the bones.
Isidro tears his glove off.
Flowing Corazonix has filled every gash and hole that the Arts energy had left upon his flesh.
It is now as one with him.
He picks up his sword with his right arm, and points it at Anastasio's face.
